As I was eating a slice, I thought, wow, this is incredibly good. The more I ate and the more I looked at the crust the more skeptical I became that it was actually gluten free. So I did a google image search for Slice House gluten free and found a picture of their gluten free pizza. Sure enough, it bore the characteristics of your typical gluten free pizza: flat and crispy. Not anything like this "gluten free" pizza we'd been delivered.

An hour later I started feeling the effects. Guys, this is not a minor gluten exposure. For a celiac, eating an entire slice of REAL pizza is horribly damaging. Fortunately I seem to be spared the more painful effects most celiacs encounter, but still had to cancel my evening plans and hunker down. I'm planning to be under the weather for the next few days and it'll be at least a couple of weeks before I'm back to normal.

Here's the thing: If you're going to offer a gluten free option, you have to be on top of that shit. It's great that they have a disclaimer about cross contamination. But their staff needs to be really attentive to when a GF pizza has been ordered. It's serious. People become debilitated by eating a thing they think is GF when it's actually the MOST gluteny thing out there. (Pizza flour has extra gluten, FYI.)

Also? Your gluten free option shouldn't cost 3x what the regular option costs. That's just obscene.

In conclusion, DO NOT go here if you're avoiding gluten. They absolutely fail.
author: Heather H.

description:
Very disappointing we love Tony's Pizza but the overall experience was simply horrible. We arrived at 620 and got our pizza at 745. It started with the cashier there was a long line yes but when I got there he had no personality and seemed glue less after I asked about certain sliced pizzas. The ones I chose he indicated that he cannot offer because they ran out of the dough for that type of pizza. This is a Friday night before a Giants game which is down the street. Next I finally ordered a whole pie was given a number and we sat viable to all as waiters kept passing by us. Initially the cashier said that the wait would be 15 to 20 minutes. Once we hit 30 minutes I asked for assistance. At first the waiter came up and said the Pie would be out in five.  four other times I asked for the manager. He eventually came up at 45 minutes to say that the Our meal would be comped but the pie still did not come and he never came up with th credit. We finally was ready to walk out I went to get the credit and then after I got the credit they delivered the pizza to our table but still nice I got the credit the waiter was ready to take our pizza away because we got the credit.  the pizza ended up under cooked and frankly no where near the standards of Tony.

It was clear that this restaurant has major service issues and management needs to get on it right away.
author: Hans H.

description:
Fantastic pizza here. Came for a slice but am drooling for another. They have a pizza slice and beer special for 8.99. Doesn't get much better than that. 
I ordered the slice of the day and it came with perfectly cooked bacon and interesting purple potatoes.
The slices were huge and thin, exactly how I like pizza. 
My wife doesn't really care for pizza much but she enjoyed this place thoroughly. 
We ate just before the Giants game and it was the perfect place to go for pre-game. It had plenty of big screen T.V.'s and was very close to AT&T. 
Would definitely come here again.
author: A M.

description:
Was a little nervous about getting a slice in Cali (My experience at GV Pizza in LA set my expectations low low low for pizza by the slice). But this place delivered. Crispy crust, good sauce-to-cheese ratio, very close to what I'm used to at my old NYC - NJ stomping grounds. 
The cost per slice is a little high ($5 for a plain is a little high, even for NY standards) but worth it for a quality taste of NY.
author: Isaac T.

description:
No other way to "SLICE" it (yuk yuk) -- the SLICE HOUSE has saved SF from being tossed into the "great city, shitty pizza" pile. I've lived here for 4 years -- and was totally spoiled by NY pizza. I roamed around in search of, frankly, just a decent pie, particularly after my search waned on. BEHOLD! The SLICE HOUSE. Hold on.... $5 a slice? Say what? Well... the slices are as big as my ex boyfriend's head (nickname: BUCKETHEAD). So chill about the price... one slice will fill or stuff you. 

Environment is totally chill -- a little bit of everyone (although mostly locals, thank you). A couple of big screen TV's have sports of some type. Soccer in Latin America -- but no  Donald -- or Brangelina. Score.

Apparently, the owner is a muckety muck in the pizza world-- a grand poobah of fine pizza making. And it shows.

Happy hour Monday-Friday from 3-5:30pm --slices are $4. Wine and drinks are discounted -- but IDK how much.
author: Teet S.

description: Ok so don't come here if you are fluent in Spanish you may just over hear the women who likes talking about how when she calls her husband a ---- and grabs his ---!!! Then she ha ha ha while your trying to eat. My husband and I and my 15 year old are down from Chula Vista for the Stanford Camp and stopped by for a bite before the game and of course we're bilingual but C'mMmonn ....
author: Diana M.

description: Man at first I was like $5 for once slice of cheese pizza? Just a cheese? C'mon! But once I got the slice...I knew why. Beautiful color, seriously though, the cheese was a beautiful freakin color of "cooked melty-ness" and there was all this seasoning. The tomato sauce was soOoOoO good, flavorful and a good amount. 4 stars cause I like pizzas a little thicker and it was so good that I wish it was a little thicker of a slice
author: Suria S.

description:
SLICE HOUSE is definitely a great place to grab some grub near AT&T Park. However, it is sort of overrated because of Tony owns it. I went after The Giants Run and enjoyed a couple slices and some beer. 

I had a slice of the Pepperoni and a slice of the Sicilian. The pepperoni was very good. I liked it because their pepperoni is exceptionally spicy! The pepperoni slice is NY style - big, thin and crispy. The Sicilian was a thicker square slice with meats and fresh mozzarella. I liked the pepperoni better, but the wife liked the Sicilian better. Both were solid. 

Only downfall - really weird and crappy beer selection. Pabst, Hamms, Olympia? Come on...

4.25 stars!
author: Joel V.

description: hmmmm, in my mind, overrated and underwhelming to tony's in north beach. BY FAR. to be fair though, we only got slices, so would be happy to come back to try the actual pizzas. i got the grandma sicilian style, and boi the tomato basil slice. he was really happy with the crust on his slice because it held up really well.. my crust i thought was too dough-y and a bit undercooked, but i havent had much sicilian style pizza to really judge. the wings (6 for $10) were not delicious, so probably will not be having those anytime soon.  overall - good spot in soma for pizza (its a 10 minute walk for me) but...not comparable to NB locale!
author: Christina L.

description: So yummy! Highly recommend! Got a pepperoni slice and it was bomb.com. Place was clean and I was in and out in like 10-15 minutes
author: Madi M.

description: Well...great price and location before the game. $9 for a generpus slice and a pint. But the pizza was fair. Although the sauce was suoer tastey...the basil was limited on my cheese and basil slice and the crust was actually tough.  Ambiance was ok for SF...a pizza joint. I expect more in this city.
author: Laura P.

description:
Pretty tasty slice but at 5 to 6 bucks a slice a bit pricey.

Also dont understand why the cheese slice is same price as pepperoni slice?

Usually you get a break on cheese...

but worth a bite if your hankering for a slice!
author: Steven W.

description: Delicious slice pizza with premium pricing. Only the lower level was open and we couldn't find anywhere for our toddler to sit without view of the TV screen. Might stop by again to pick up slices but find somewhere to take it to go.
author: Elaine S.

description:
I really like this place because the food is tasty, the staff is super nice, and wait times are low. That trifecta is a rarity in the SOMA area.

I've only tried the pizza offerings. They usually have 3 at least: pepperoni (comes with those tiny ones, and covering the pizza edge-to-edge!), cheese (pretty good), and grandma's (forget the toppings) which I thought was just OK.

1) The pizza slices are LARGE. If you're a two slice person elsewhere, one will be good here. Ask them to cut in half and it'll be easier to fold. This also saves you monies which is a good thing in this city. ;-)

2) The pizza (at least pepperoni) is greasy. You may need to deploy the napkin dab technique.

3) They refill fountain drinks without complaints. Woo.

I'd probably avoid this place on SF Giant's days though. It must get crazy in there.

Suggestion to owner: How about offering up some of the speciality pizzas listed on menu as lunch time slice options?
author: Pedrum M.

description: Great food for dinner. This place makes pizza with artisinal grains and home made pastas! Whole pies and or slices can be purchased. Rocking place!
author: Sharon S.

description:
What can I say? This is Tony Geminani at his best. I have missed this pizza so much since he closed down his Castro Valley restaurant, Pyzano's.  I love the sauce - there is always enough and it is seasoned well.  But the crust!! Don't even get me started on this....you will not throw the crust away - you just can't.  It's the perfect thinness/thickness but soft and chewy at the same time.  I drive 50 minutes for this stuff...no joke.  I love this pizza so much that Lombardi's in NY was a disappointment to me. I know, right?!!  They will make the standard pizza for you, but urge you to try their custom pizzas.  You can't go wrong.

It's a great place to watch games - very sports bar-casual-friendly vibe.  Make sure to call ahead to see if there are any schedule changes due to Giant's games - they alter their business hours to coincide/work with the games.
author: Caroline K.

description: This is amazing pizza and they have beer so this place is great. Pricey per slice but it's the best pizza I've had on the west coast
author: Cy D.

description: Love the pizza at this place- does not get better than here! But 2 stars because of hygiene. I've come here a ton of times, and when you order a slice or two, the guy who is at the cash register tears off the slices and puts it in the box. He goes from exchanging everyone's cash, credit cards, pen, touching the cash register, to touching the pizza without washing his hands or wearing gloves. I've seen this at least 10 times and it's always the same guy. They need to keep an eye on hygiene standards. Makes me wonder what I am not seeing.
author: M M.

description:
This location of Tony's pizza is perfect as it's just down the street from our place.  I've always been a fan of his pizza and this location is no different.  We got the meatballs (huge with lots of sauce), mixed green salad (loved the vinaigrette dressing) and the Crazy 8 pizza.  Everything was really good.  We had a few pieces left over and they were almost better the next day.  The crust on the pizza is so good.

We'll definitely be back for some more good pizza!
author: Blake B.

description: Decent, super greasy pizza. Plenty of places with thinner crust, but this place is quite good. Just not spectacular. I don't know how the Tony's restaurant is, but if it's the same, it's not worth the wait. I like this place, I've been many times and and would go back, but can't say that it's so good that I must go back all the time.
author: Alton Y.

description: Perfect spot for a late night slice of pizza or dinner in the neighborhood. Reasonably priced per slice and great beer selection. Closest to NYC pizza I've had here in SF!
author: Mileen Z.

description:
My new favorite pizza place in San Francisco.  Having an office a block away is going to be dangerous.

Simple choices for lunch -- cheese, pepperoni, Sicilian, or grandma pies, by the slice or whole (20"), or meatball subs, or salads.  SOMA pricing ($5-6/slice), so not cheap, but not out of line with anything else in the area.  So far I've tried several kinds of pizza and the meatballs; all perfect -- the best I've had anywhere.  Absolutely will return.

The only criticism I have is the line of people out the door waiting for pizza.  Three weeks after it opened, and there's still a line out the door at lunch.  They're not particularly fast for single slice orders, but not slow either, and probably bottlenecked by rate of production.  This is a high class problem to have, though.
author: Ryan L.

description:
So, my bf found this place after walking down the street and after some research, I realized the owner actually had his original shop in my hometown!

The day before our half marathon (and our friend's 52.4 mile ultra marathon), we decided to gather for an early dinner. My bf had couple slices of their pepperoni pizza and I had an order of their meatballs. My meatballs were good, juicy, flavorful, and submerged in sauce. My bf's pizza was pretty good, too. Lots of pepperoni and not too greasy. Their slices are quite generous.

Would I return? Maybe -- my bf was a fan, but I don't think this is a kind of pizza I would necessarily crave.
author: Leana L.

description:
Pizza maestro Tony Gemignani continues to build his delicious pizza empire. 

Now open on Second Street about a block from AT&T Park where he has two slice counters is Slice House. Offering classic New York, Sicilian, and grandma pies whole or by the slice, Slice House knocks it out of the park.

As expected all styles of pizza are excellent. The crust is just the right mix of crispy and chewy and, of course, has the perfect char. The New York style is better than Grimaldi's in Brooklyn.  The thicker Sicilian will have you drueling for more. The "grandma" style is really just like your nona used to make. Also as tasty are the grinders, pastas, and even gluten-free pizza.

The restaurant is counter service: you wait in line to order and pay, then take a seat, although finding one at lunch can be a challenge, and your order is brought to you. Be aware: lines can be long at lunch and on game days.

Slice House offers a few wines, but more importantly to accompany the pizza, it offers a good selection of local craft beers. 

Service is quick and efficient. Soft drinks were refilled even during the lunch hour rush. 

Slice House will do more than fulfill your pizza craving. Welcome to the neighborhood, Tony.
author: CJ G.

description:
Great spot to pick up dinner to-go in SOMA. The pizza cost about $6 a slice but the slices are HUGE - one slice is close to an entire quarter of a large pizza at chains. The garlic bread with cheese is quite nommy, so much that the discomfort you experience from consuming all that butter and oil is worth it. The wings and the artichoke pasta salad were very average, so I would skip that. 

The restaurant is clean and not too crowded during dinner hours. Their ranch is apparently housemade. And, they also have pasta!
author: Melody Y.

description:
Small place, so go a little early if you plan to dine-in.

Loved the food and service here.  The pizza is excellent (and by pizza I mean their crust, sauce and cheese).

I sampled the tomato pie, the pepperoni, and something called "Mama's".

The winner was the tomato pie, it was awesomely good in every respect.  The pepperoni had the same crust and sauce, but was stacked with way too many slices of pep.  The grease slick was overwhelming.  I ended up tearing off the crust and eating that only.

The Mama's was a different style, square/pan shaped slices.  The dough was very hard, a little too tough I thought.  The toppings were excellent, especially the sauce.

One slice is enough for a good sized lunch.
author: Patrick S.

description:
This review is for their AYCE weekend brunch. 

The only decent things were meatballs, spaghetti aglio e olio, and sausage. There was low turnover so everything else was very dry. The breakfast pizzas were lacking any kind of sauce, and were sitting under heat lamps -- so they were very dry as well. Even the fresh fruit was placed under the heat lamps.

Additionally, the champagne wasn't chilled enough and the fruit juices weren't chilled at all, so the mimosas were almost room temperature.
author: Jesse D.

description: I'll give my soggy slice of pizza to a homeless person. They'll appreciate a slice o soggy pizza. The crust is so limp and disgusting! I can't even pick it up to eat! What a waste of $5.75 for lunch.
author: Debbiedeb W.

description:
Very good but prepare for a triple bypass afterwards.  Saying it's rich is an understatement.

I had a slice of the pepperoni which looked like a caricature.  So many slices of pepperoni that it look the pizza had craters.  They were tasty but there was a greasy puddle that could probably be sopped up by a roll of paper towels or two.  The tomato pie with basil & cheese slice was better, not greasy; just flavorful.

Tony, think of those with families that want to have a long life and take it easy on the pepperoni!
author: Saminda W.

description: Pretty good pizza to grab by the slice in SOMA. We got 2 slices of the day, a pepperoni slice, and a grandma slice. All were very light and flavorful. The service is fast and they were open for the Giants game, which is great since they are right by the field.
author: Katherine L.

description: Don't go here if you have to stick to a schedule...ordered 2 pizzas for pickup and was told 35 minutes over the phone. It took over 70 minutes! Had to cancel order and leave without any food.
author: Brian S.

description:
Need a quick slice to warm the soul? The house will handle your cravings. From Sicilian (Square cut, think Golden Boy...) to a thin crust NY slice you won't be disappointed! Came here on day two and was impressed... New SOMA spot for a slice or a meatball fix, previous home to Iron Side. 

My co-worker that is a true N.Y. East coaster says it's easily one of the best slices he's had in city. Had a Sicilian slice (Pepperoni & Sausage) and it's a pillow like focaccia crust with a mild but robust red sauce covered in toppings and was piping hot when I was called to snag it... Also took an order of Meatballs (3 for $5) are well seasoned and I can't wait to get them again next time. Get in here before the lines out the door! DON'T SAY I DIDN'T WARN YOU!
author: Josh H.

description: This place has amazing pizza! I went here accidentally at happy hour and got lucky with some awesome gourmet pizza. Here at the giants game now and had another slice and reminded how good this pizza place is.
author: Chris H.

description: Cute space, unbelievably kind and thoughtful woman working there today. She made my birthday very special with her generosity. And the sicilian slice was totally delicious.
author: Andrew K.

description:
We grabbed takeout for a business lunch after we lost our reservation at a dine in spot nearby when our meeting ran long. 

This is clearly a happening spot around lunch time and with a line out the door, it shouldn't have surprised us how long it took for our order to come together but it was still disappointing to wait 20+ minutes for the food - they were doing their best for sure, so just a warning that it's slow at lunch time. 

The pizza was good! I wish the crust was something worthwhile, all of us left our crust in the box. Most frustrating was ordering the quinoa salad, from the salad section, only to find it was quinoa PASTA - not a salad. Especially annoying since they have a separate menu for pasta and this wasn't there - it was in the section for salads. Add insult to injury that the quinoa (pasta) salad was somehow void of flavor all together. It tasted like raw boiled pasta. And with goat cheese being more mild, it needed something else - maybe some tomato, olives, dressing? I'm not sure what but no one in our group had anything good to say about it. . 

The shining moment was the sausage. Mmmm that honey sausage!!! We were told it was made with local honey from the roof of the owner's other restaurant so we got two orders - so glad we did! It was really fantastic. Something to go out of your way for. 

Overall it was AOK pizza, lying quinoa pasta salad and amazing honey sausage.
author: Sarah A.

description: Overpriced, subpar, greasy pizza. There was a puddle of grease on my plate. Soggy pizza. If you're going to charge 6 bucks for a pepperoni slice it better be good. Beer was $9 as well.
author: Alex L.

description:
A great place for lunch if you work in the area.  The pizza is made fresh, sold by the slice or in a pie.  Thick wonderful pieces of pizza joy!   A little pricey, but you can get full for $14.00 with a drink too!

Love it.  Plus they have a big-screen tv blasting sports and an upstairs dining area.  Very hip, loft-like environment.  

OH YA - they also have a stand at AT&T Park.  Go Tony G's Slice House!  :)
author: Paul R.

description:
A fantastic pizza place! Their food is fabulous and with the daily special there's a lot to discover for returning visitors.
This is also a sports bar where they show soccer (and - I imagine - other sports as well).
For me this was a great place to go for a slice during my lunch break.
author: Tom K.

description:
Oh man I'm going to be as regular here as Norm was at Cheers. Fortunately it's just far enough from where I live that it's an incentive to go for a run, so at least I won't end up looking like Norm.

Solid NY-style pizzeria. They got big foldable triangular slices, proper grandma slices, big thick Sicilian slices - what's not to love? Plus a nice set of beers on draft, and it's not even expensive, and it's open until 10. Seriously an awesome addition to the neighborhood.
author: Marco C.

description: Fantastic Pizza!   True NY Style Pizza .  A great lunch place.
author: M N.

description: Can't get the order right! Never going to eat here again. I give them -10. Made me wait 45 mins for the reorder.
author: Vidya S.

description: Flat out awesome. Was going to the game and found this place, one of the best pep slice of pizza I have ever had. A bit too greasy but such good flavor and texture I didn't  t care
author: Brad M.

description: I really want to like Tony's pizza. I'm a fan of the style, and I like his story, like the different pizza ovens etc. but I've had it twice now, and didn't really like it either time. I was excited to try the slice house near the ballpark last week, but the cheese was burned, and when I picked it up, the thing slumped over like a wet noodle.  It had absolutely no firmness to it. It's a bummer all around.
author: dave g.

description: We are always impressed not only with the taste of the pizza, but the speed in which it is delivered to the table. When you are in line at the store at 6:49, and you still see the first pitch at AT& T Park this place has a good operation.
author: Bob W.

description:
This place is very convenient to AT&T Park; was walking around the park before a Giants game and decided to try this place out... $5ish for a slice of cheese is absurd, so I got one of the chicken slices for like $6ish - either way this is very expensive!!!!

I ordered at the counter, got a number, and stood around for about 10 minutes until one of the staff asked if I needed help - they supposedly gave my pizza to another guest... so they had to make a new one and cook it for me!!

In the end, it was decent pizza but very saucy, still edible and flavourful; chicken was cooked through and cheesy!!!
author: Andrew C.

description: Pizza was awesome & it wasn't busy either so it was perfect since we had our hungry daughter w/ us. The only thing that I didn't like was the bathroom. There was only one and we had to wait if someone was in there. Didn't like that. But overall, the pizza was good & we'd definitely go back
author: Princess S.

description:
Slices are HUGE! It's a great place to go for lunch if you work in the area. They always have good slice of the day options. The pizza is pretty good, but you really want to get the garlic bread and meatballs. I'm not sure what they put in them, but they're to die for. The garlic bread is so buttery and has actual garlic cloves on it. The meatballs just melt in your mouth. 

They're pretty quick when you order so you can get out in good time. I'd definitely recommend checking it out!
author: Elizabeth K.

description: Awful. Terrible pizza. Doughy. Pasta was like ketchup sauce. There should be no difference between what you cook to deliver v. cook to eat in - deliver service was a joke.
author: taste e.

description:
We are a big fan of Tony's original restaurant in North Beach. We frequently take out of town family members to a treat at his pizza restaurant. Had been to the Slice House at ATT&T Park so my wife and I were delighted when Tony's took over an existing restaurant space on 2nd Street. Because...

It's within walking distance from place. Just dropped in last night on the way home and grabbed a couple of slices. I got for any special with a lot of meat on it. Meatballs....oh yeah!!!

Sometimes times with get the large order with extra sauce and turn it into spaghetti and meatballs when we get home. 

Be sure to grab a slice before a game. They have more options that in the park and you avoid the higher tariff in the park...
author: Aldon H.

description: We called in our order to pick up from Slice House this past weekend, and I couldn't believe a) how empty the restaurant itself was for a Saturday and b) how delicious their pizzas are despite it not being the original Tony's.  I'm a sucker for their margherita pizza, but that always comes with the wait.  Instead, we went with The Wiseguy pizza and Mostaccioli ala Vodka Cream for dinner.  Two very hungry adults took down The Wiseguy pizza, and an overly hungry one person took down the mostaccioli.  All in all, it was gluttony at its finest that night, and I have zero regrets when it comes down to chomped down on half a pizza.  The Wiseguy comes with some spicy sausage, hot pepper oil, and it's topped with little bursts of mozzarella.  About midway through, that mozzarella came in handy when the spicy sausage got to being a little too much for me.  I will definitely be back here, especially since picking up an order was almost a little too easy!
author: Lisa I.

description:
The food is nice when you can get it. The main problem is they lock their doors more than an hour before their posted closing time. I once brought a group of 10 people to their door at 8:58pm after verifying on yelp they were open till 10pm. Door was locked. I was sad.

A few weeks later I brought a Chicago lady there at 9:15. Doors locked. I was annoyed.

Now tonight I'm at work late thinking man I want some pizza it's 8:45pm. Slice house is open. Is it though? I no longer care. I'm done trying. 

I'm trying amicci's on king st. Instead.
author: Jonathan P.

description:
The one star is for the service.  I ask cashier for the ready to go pizza right next to her, trying to catch a show, she says, "no problem", takes my money, next thing I know I'm waiting 40 minutes for a whole pizza to come out of the oven.  Seriously, don't promise what you can't deliver.  Really jacks up a person's evening, when you're request is simple and time dependent.  

Food -  3 stars.  Good crust w/ good spice pepperoni.  Nothing amazing.
author: Mo m.

description: A great place to sit down and have a beer what Amazing Pizza they have fresh ingredients tomatoes and the crust has a great chew! The aroma when you walk in will take you off in to Pizza Heaven. I recommend the tomato pie with cheese and basil but that's my preference and they have so many great options, I'm sure they have a pizza for you!
author: Michael G.

description: The slices we had were great. They had that hard to achieve gooey top with a crispy and chewy crust. Cold beers were a great accompaniment. The slices were also huge....we each ordered 2 pieces and had plenty leftover for lunch the next day. The tomato and mozzarella, pepperoni, and daily pie (kale & sausage ) were our choices and did not disappoint. Maybe slightly more per slice than we'd typically pay for a large pie, but the variety was worth it.
author: Sarah M.

description: Very large slices.  Thin.  Fresh.  A bit on the expsenive side.  Large place with downstairs and upstairs seating.  Order at the counter and they will bring you your pizza at your table.  Beer and wine.   Large TVs for sports viewing as well.  My new go to now that SBC has closed.
author: Jeff J.

description: OH MY GOD WHY WAS IT SO HOT IN HERE!!!! Seriously...like sweating bullets into my nice slice of pizza kind of hot. The pizza was good, as usual, but my friend and I ate as fast as we could just to get out. It was not enjoyable and they really need to figure out the whole heating issues.
author: Hayley H.

description:
I'm a fan of Tony's in North Beach, one of the few places I can get a NJ-style tomato pie (like the ones I grew up with on the East Coast). I was excited to try this outpost from Tony, given the location and the fact that you don't have to endure the ridiculous wait times. 

I stopped by for lunch today and grabbed a tomato pie slice. It was incredibly greasy. I'm not one who typically shies from grease or dabs the slice with a napkin. But this slice was an oil slick, such that I had to eat it with a knife and fork. The crust was a tad too thick and tasteless. The whole thing had a slightly burned taste; not from a nice char...more like the cheese had been reheated a few too many times or the oil was rancid. Something was just off. This was nowhere near as respectable as what I've had at Tony's and certainly nothing like the real deal on the East Coast.  

To top it all off, a slice and a Coke set me back $9 before tip (I mean, the Coke alone was a ridiculous $3). Hey, I'm used to inflated food prices in SF and will gladly pay it for good eats. But this was totally a waste of money.
author: Michelle F.

description: Meh. Came here with a small group on a Giants game night. Quick line, quick order, then waited OVER AN HOUR for our pizza. It was a very simple order and shouldn't have taken that long. The two tables next to us got their pizza, ate, and left before we had received our order. Every time we asked about the wait there was no response. Finally the very apologetic manager came and said sorry and that he had made the pizza himself, but nothing other than that. No free drinks or dessert or sympathy for the fact that we waited so long we missed the beginning of the game. Pizza was fine. The crust was AMAZING, but toppings and flavors were eh. Probably won't be coming back.
author: Kate S.

description:
easy 3-3.5 stars

Drive by this place several times and decided to stop in for lunch - going to try 2 slices : pepperoni and Sicilian. 
Line to order - Long. 15-20 people and it is moving REALLY slow. Order at a counter then you go sit down. 
Committed myself to try this spot otherwise I would have already left. 20+ min wait to order seems ridiculous. 
Seating - sparkly populated. Tons of open seating. 
Ordered. 5 min wait is what I am told.  Took less than 2. 

Sicilian : square slice, focaccia bread style pizza, thicker crust.  a little too much bread for me but was still a solid slice.

Pepperoni : large traditional slice, prob 6".  tons of peperoni but a bit heavy on the grease.  Good, but not great. was a bit underwhelmed.

8 beers on tap - ok selection. About half are local. 
Dozen beer options in bottles/can. Mostly crap.
author: Ben C.

description:
Carb load.

Bay To Breakers tradition: Friday before the race we meet for carbs. 

Last year: http://www.yelp.com/biz/cotogna-san-francisco?hrid=eT2RgOM2LuhEWZq2l86RkQ

This year: Pizza slice topped with tomatoes and basil, homemade foccaccia with grilled chicken and avocado and pasta with tomato sauce.

Rich flavor and fresh ingredients were consistent across them all. Prices varied from a too expensive $13 sandwich, just right $5 pizza slice and a $9 steal pasta.

Returned for a potent if slightly bland Americano ($3 included sugar free vanilla syrup). Discovered the sweet, spongy cinnamon bread pudding brilliance. $7 and so worth it.

Space continues the rustic and inviting feel of the old Ironside: http://insidescoopsf.sfgate.com/blog/2015/03/23/ironside-to-close-tony-gemignanis-slice-house-moving-in/

Staff has an earnest, friendly vibe that makes you feel welcome and valued.

Bay To Breakers result: One second from a personal best (55:29).

Slice House result: Four stars.
author: Jason B.

description: I usually picky with Pizza but I have been here several times and have never been disappointed. The order process is quick and the staff here has always been great!
author: Steve S.

description: Cashier dude was super rude.  I got the special slice of the day for $7 and it was def not worth $7 plus tax.  Flavors did not impress at all and it tasted dry.  Asked for a side of ranch and they were trying to charge an additional 50 cents, hail to the naw.  The worst part was the cashiers attitude tho.
author: Esther L.

description: Dude. This place is delicious. Every single thing I have had here has really been a great meal. There is no need for articulation after so many reviews. Just come here and spend ten bucks on a beautiful slice and a beer and have some good mouth feels.
author: Niana D.

description: I wanted a meatball sub, but alas.... they were out. Had a slice (cheese pizza) instead. Crispy crust. Nice tomato sauce and perfect amount of cheese. So looking forward to trying the other variety of pizza slices.... and getting that meatball sub!
author: Darrin D.

description: Best slice in town! Giant like the "Giants".  Don't even think of going to a baseball game without smuggling in a pie from this awesome place!
author: Stuart C.

description: Quick stop before the Giants game and the pizza was perfect! Although it is a little pricey. 35$ for a pitcher and  a slice of cheese pizza. Definitely will come again when I'm in the city. I love the upstairs seating too
author: Chelsea N.

description:
ok. i know my pizza standards are practically unreachable to US pizzerie, but WOW was this pizza (and establishment) especially fucking terrible (which reminds me... a long time ago i went to their location in north beach and they forgot my order.) 

anyway...

i walk in. the restaurant is not busy; there is no line. homeboy at the register sees me but doesn't bother to acknowledge my existence at all: we're off to a great start. i say hello to him. i go ahead and order a slice of cheese since it looks like the freshest pizza, only to notice that there is an entirely full plate of cheese underneath, from which he chose my slice (of course). it's whatever. so i wait for my pizza at the counter. once homeboy #2 running orders slides my slice at me with a weak "here u go," i see he has without any prior notice already put parmesan cheese on my pizza. i don't even know why you're supposed to say 'already' when i don't ever actually put parmesan cheese on my cheese pizza. seriously americans... what the fuck is up with putting bad quality cheese that sits out ALL DAY, FOREVER on top of your (cheese) pizza ??? why did he put *A TON* of parmesan on my pizza without asking ????? 

whatever. i deal with it. i put oregano on top and walk out. upon my first thru last bite, i realize... this pizza has no distinguishable pizza flavors. i couldn't taste the tomato, couldn't tell you if it was fresh, canned, seasoned, i have literally no idea because i couldn't taste it. the mozzarella (if one could call it that) was less flavorful than string cheese.... the crust literally could have been a piece of cardboard and i wouldn't have noticed any difference. it kind of tasted like... cardboard with essence of stinkbug.

save yourself $5.50(+) and trek to arinell's or golden boy if you're really craving a dank slice. it's worth it.
author: Yves D.

description: Much needed addition to the neighborhood. Generous sized slices, thin crisp crust, yummy ingredients, and quick service make this a fav spot.
author: tureg u.

description: I was salivating over the fresh and uncut cheese pie but when I ordered my $5.00 cheese slice I got some slice that was not from that fresh uncut pizza pie. I was disappointed because it was old and over-cooked. I'll think about going back.
author: Infodiva B.

description:
Oh noooooooooooooooo...

Tony, tony, tony (not the band)... what happened?

As you can see by my other reviews I am a fan of Tony. But this place was not good. I don't want to get into details. I was really disappointed.

Service, pizza, price... all poor. Giving two stars because I've only been there once and maybe it was an off day. I hope so Tony, I really do.
author: Pink F.

description:
Hands down, the best slice of pizza i've had in a good while. Found this little gem thanks to a friend who's walked past this place on several occasions but never stopped. 

Nice outdoor seating, good for people watching. Inside is a little cramp, and there is one big bench to sit should you be inclined to do so. 

Was really craving a pepperoni pizza, but unfortunately they were out, so opted for the sausage, and was not disappointed. My friends each got the meat lovers and picante. All great choices. Definitely a fan, and most certainly coming back.
author: Laurens D.

description:
Spoiler Alert - Tony G makes the best pizza in California, and has an uncanny ability to open new restaurants and maintain that quality even if he isn't making the pies. Must help to teach at a pizza school :)

But if you are on the way to the ballpark, this is a great slice to bring in. I have been there twice, and both are great - his thin crust and thick. I haven't tried the meatballs yet, but if they are anything like his other locations, I am sure they are fantastic as well. 

Good thing I don't go to as many games as I used to, or else I would be putting on a decent amount of pizza weight.
author: Sam A.

description: For starters, it was our first time here and we are hella lucky to live one block away from this joint. I started my dinner with a mixed green salad and my wife with a spaghetti with some type of amazing spicy sausage of some sort. I think she meant to order some other pasta but they brought this and it was pretty dam goodie! Then we ordered a pie with cheese and basil;.... Mmmmmmmm. Perfect! Perfect ration of sauce, cheese and basil, but we ordered our pie extra crispy and man!..., let me tell you! It was !!!! Something about the crust is just totally different and super delicious! They say New York pizza is all about the water they use for the crust, but I'm pretty sure that's not the case here, just solid fresh ingredients! We waited about 10-15 for our pizza, so the service for timing was excellent! Thank you Slice House Crew! We'll be back next time with friends and family!!!
author: david g.

description: Best meatballs / meatball sub ever - one of my favorite foods which I've tried in many different variations across the world. Amazing flavor, texture, sauce, cheese. The bread is garlic bread which makes it awesome. Service was friendly. BTW pizza is awesome too, especially the chewy cheese they use.
author: Sergei B.

description: Pizza is very good but the service was poor. Waited 45 minutes for a large pepperoni. The manager did cover the pizza once I brought the wait time to his attention. Would come back.
author: James L.

description: This is an easy one...great pizza...if you like pizza, go there and eat the pizzas.  The only downside is if there is a baseball game happening it can be a bit of madhouse but seriously, just go and the pizza, it is bomb!!!  All of them!!
author: David P.

description:
This pizza shop has a nice pub ambience to it. Located just a few blocks from where the Giants play, this place can get rather busy during game days.

I came here and grabbed a slice of Sicilian and some German Wings on the side. The pizza slice was pretty big and almost filling, but the wings topped my dinner off nicely. Since I ordered one of the slices off the windowed display, a food runner came and delivered it at my table after they reheated it in an oven. It's not as good as a fresh baked pizza, but for around 5 bucks, it was pretty satisfying.

The wings were pretty good in terms of flavor and how easily it came off the bone, but it certainly wasn't freshly made. I could tell they reheated them because the thicker pieces were a little colder on the inside. It wasn't ice cold or anything. It just wasn't fresh.

Overall it's a pretty nice place to grab some grub before a game. They have a good variety of beers on tap.
author: Trent L.

description: I LOVE Tony's Pizza Napoletana. Almost every trip we make to the city includes a stop at Tony's by Washington Square. After catching the Giants Vs Orioles game at AT&T park, we thought we would save ourselves some time yet still get our Tony's fix by stopping in at Slice House. We entered the restaurant where there were 3 or 4 tables taken, and no line. The girl at the counter was very unfriendly. My husband and I each ordered a slice of pepperoni, and I also got a slice of the tomato pie. We took our seats, and about 5 minutes later were handed our slices. I guess they reheated them in their oven because the pepperoni was blackened and burnt, and way too greasy. The beautiful white mozzarella cheese on my tomato pie looked like a toasted marshmallow, and was completely hardened (see my picture). Our meal was inedible. Maybe the slices are good when they are fresh out of the oven, but the service and food we received in no way even resembles the delicious food served at Tony's original establishment. Save yourself a major disappointment and just go to the original location.
author: Julianne G.

description: We made it in just in time before the restaurant was about to close after a Cubbies Vs Giants game. The pizza was excellent!! We ordered each a single slice of pizza and it was huge. I would highly recommend this pizza place. This would be an awesome place to just drink beer and eat pizza and enjoy watching sports. Go CUBBIES Go!
author: Nicole Z.

description:
Not a huge variety of slices, but REALLY REALLY delicious thin crust pizza. 

I got the tomato pie with cheese and basil. It's a generous slice (I had one for lunch and was full). Crispy crust, thick and creamy sauce, overall a super enjoyable meal. 

If they had a few more toppings options for by the slice, I'd give them a 5, but they just opened, so it's totally reasonable they launch with 3 options. 

I'll be back!
author: Dimple B.

description:
okay -- I ripped them a new one when they deserved it -- so I now must update my review, as they seem to have solved the problems I talked about in my first review.  

Now, amazing pizza with competent service too.  I ordered a 'custom' pizza -- which I figured would be Not Possible -- but I was cheerfully accommodated.  And the kinks in the service with takeout seem to have been worked out.   

Highly recommend and glad to have these guys in the neighborhood.
author: Jaina S.

description: Finally tried this place. Now I know why Tony's has won so many awards for best pizza. The thin crust has good texture and crunch when you take a bite. Will be going back often. Slices start at $5. Monday-Friday's on non-game days they have happy hour prices.
author: Robin L.

description: What can a say the reputation for this place stands tall. Fine establishment with awesome slices! Living in Cali is hard for pizza lovers, but I can easily say you'll feel like your in New York with the slices. Try the pepperoni just nicely sauced with a perfect spice to the pepperoni. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
author: Idin H.

description: Love this brunch! Great food, great staff and love that they have the Giants playing on the big screen!
author: Kristy W.

description: 1 slice of pepperoni pizza = heart attack. But it's that good! Lots of pepperoni, super duper large slice & it's made with zero zero flour which is the best! Long lines during game times but other than that solid place!
author: C A.

description: Someone brought two of these pies to a Warriors party two weeks ago.  I was addicted immediately; best pizza in the city by far.  So good I have been there myself twice in two weeks.  Pretty pricey at over $30 for a pizza, but ok by the slice.  Perfect crust, aged cheese and not skimpy on the toppings.  A new favorite.  Parking sucks.
author: Ken P.

description: Best DARN pizza I have ever had. Reminds me of NY pizza except the quality of the ingredients seems to be better here than over there!
author: Mel S.

description: This place has potential because the pizza was actually not bad.  However, came here on a friday night and they were out of everything.  The only pizza they had left was cheese and peperroni.  On top of that, prices are a bit steep.  Really wished this place gave me a better experience but it didn't and here we are....me writing bad yelp reviews when i dont really want to.
author: Vince L.

description: Pizza is fantastic. I wish I didn't have to wait in such a sloooow liiiiiiine. It's pizza slices. Shouldn't you be able to keep a line moving during the lunch hour?  20 min long line is average wait.
author: Bumbaklot R.

description:
They seemed to have fixed there service issues.... Thank goodness. 

The pizza is still great for a slice... Gotta try the happy hour.
author: Jon H.

description: Got the cal italia pizza for lunch. It supposedly won a gold medal, which is definitely well deserved. Pretty big, I split it with my coworker and we were both stuffed. Wasn't too expensive either, came to about $26. It was delicious, the fig jam was very unique and tasted great mixed with the prosciutto. I would definitely stop by again. It did take awhile for the pizza to be finished though, so if you're in a rush, this might not be a good spot.
author: Sean W.

description:
Dangerously great.  I've always been a big fan of Tony's North Beach location, but I don't make it that way too often.  The new Slice House is just a couple blocks from my office, and, after my first visit, I'm afraid of reverting to my college diet of pizza and... more pizza.

I'm originally from New Jersey and have high standards for NY-style pizza.  Tony's is one of the few in the Bay Area that can legitimately claim to do it right.

My only criticism is that the slices are a bit pricey, but you can make a full meal out of one of them if you're so inclined, given the size.
author: Brian T.

description: Our first visit here based on a recommendation - very nice pizza place ! They offer slices, small "2 person" pies and larger as well, as well as salads and meatball sandwiches. Slices include pepperoni, cheese, Margherita, and specialty choices. Large slices for about $6. Was going to try the pasta but - strangely - the pasta is only available after 3:30 pm !  We think it would be a good lunch option, not sure why the time limit on it. The 13 inch is $24 and offers nine styles. We opted for the Genoa - pesto, mozzarella, sun dried tomatoes, castelvetrano olives, feta and roasted garlic cloves. It was delicious and just the right portions of all toppings, especially the pesto which we loved.  Also had a classic Caesar salad (with anchovies!) and the artichoke pasta salad - both were good sized and excellent taste. The place itself is of nice ambience - wood interior and cozy feeling, with TVs and a second floor seating area as well. Very busy at lunch, mainly take-out service and it was easy to get a table. No table service (except food delivery) so be sure to order at counter before claiming a seat. Overall a nice lunch - but next time a salad and ONE slice would be fine - took two slices of the pizza with us because we just ate too much !!
author: Mark K.

description: Ordered a whole tomato and cheese pie togo.  Came severely overcooked.  Crust was dark brown and so crunchy my teeth hurt. The cheese was dead  This place is only good when the owner is watching the food go out. I was really disappointed and so were my  friends that were visiting from out of town.
author: C F.

description: Relative to the neighboring options, this place is easily a 5 star. Objectively, this is a good solid 4 star pizza joint. Pizza is great, but not life-changing. Salads are solid and priced appropriately. Get the meatballs if you're avoiding the evil carbs... damn good. There's beer on tap... what else do you need to know? Don't waste your time trying on a Giants game day, surely it'll be packed to the gills.
author: Trey D.

description: Good pizza but what a cluster fuck. Lost our order. Overall crowded and disorganized but I do have to say the pizza was pretty good
author: Sanda P.

description: Are you kidding me? It does NOT, repeat NOT get any better than this. Fantastic. My only complaint: make the slices smaller lol. Their huge!  Worth the price. I'm hooked.
author: M D.

description: First time there with a groupon and will definitely be back! We came in about 30 minutes before they closed and we got our pizza's super fast!! Cashier (Dillon) went out of his way to  be helpful and friendly, as well as the rest of the staff! Pizza was hot and fresh!! Spot on!!
author: Stacy K.

description: Pizza at the slice house was amazing. Great atmosphere and really close to the stadium. Would definitely go here again.
author: D R.

description: The Groupon Gods shined on us - rarely can you score a $50 deal for $25 at a place you want to eat at.  Clearly the Slice House is jammed during Giants season and games and is quite other times. The pizza was excellent and it is mainly because of high quality ingredients and killer gravy or red sauce ! The meat balls are also excellent and benefit from that damn crazy good sauce ! Happy hour M-F is a time to return for $2 slices and beer specials ! Go and eat great pizza here ! Tony, this boy from da Bronx is glad youz are here making quality pies !
author: alan c.

description: Omg heaven in my mouth!!! The pizza was the best I've ever had in my life and I eat a lot of pizza! Definitely worth the wait! Waited about 25 minutes. The actual restaurant 3 doors down was a 2 hour wait. I'm super happy with the pizza I got! Pepperoni!
author: Jez G.

description: This is the best slice of pizza outside of any of my favorite Neapolitan pizza places or that one Pinsa place.  There's nothing even a close second to this pizza.  Yeah it's a little expensive than id like (at $3 a slice this would be a steal) but at least the slices are a bit bigger.
author: Sanket K.

description: Been here twice and the service was a let down both times. This time was just the last straw. Took an hour to get the pizza and when I kept asking someone about it they kept ignoring me. After 45 min I asked how much longer and then they realized they forgot to put my order in... not a single apology.
author: Sarah P.

description:
Normal menu / pizza by the slice:
There's something about their sauce that I just can't get enough of. Whether it's on a meatball or on a pizza, it's absolutely delicious. I also really like their pizza crust, but then again, I'm a crust lover. You're more likely to find pizza remains whose crusts have vanished on my plate when I leave.

New brunch buffet:
My husband and I stopped by this morning and saw they had their new brunch buffet open. They had a bit of everything - breakfast pizzas, frittata, lasagna, spaghetti, meatballs, and then breakfast favorites like eggs, potatoes, and bacon. In general, it was delicious. Their lasagna was delicious (have I mentioned how much I like their sauce?) and their custard french toast was pretty killer. Actually, it was a bit more like bread pudding made from french toast, which is totally ok with me. All in all, a delicious experience.

One piece of feedback for Slice House is that their brunch serving sizes are a bit too big. Their breakfast pizza slices and frittata are the size of a normal slice. Considering one of those slices can be basically a meal, it was hard to try everything I wanted to try. I'd love to see them do much smaller portion sizes for a buffet so people can sample smaller bits of more things (without preventing people who want to go all-in from doing so).
author: Erin B.

description: The thing I love about their pizza is this: it's good cold. I don't know, the hot pizza is overwhelmingly satisfying but cold? Awesome as well!
author: Dominique S.

description: Went here for the first time today, and I already knew their pizza was gonna be good! They have the pizza displayed at the front behind a glass. They look so greasy and they are packed with meat! I'm giving 4 stars because although the pizza was great the customer service was not so much.. Their employees are young but not very friendly or enthusiastic, they could definitely have a better attitude towards their job. I get it, no one likes their jobs but jeeze don't show it that much. Other than that, everything was fine. Definitely would return.
author: Diego D.

description: Came here for dinner last night in a group of 12 so we got to try almost everything! Meatballs and wings were great. Mixed green and Caesar salads also great (I personally prefer the crispness of the Caesar, anchovies added great flavor). Bucatini pasta was also great! I've never tried/seen this pasta anywhere else; it's like a mix between spaghetti and udon noodles -- much thicker and more elastic than your average old spaghetti. Sauce was also hearty and had just the right amount of spice. We also tried the grandma and a regular pepperoni/mushroom pizza. Everything was yum! Can't wait to come back!
author: Sabrina L.

description:
good pizza by the slice.  i had the tomato and basil pie, and my brother had the sicilian.  both of us liked our pizzas, and they were quite filling.  

the slices here are cheaper and better tasting than the ones in the ballpark, so if you are going to the giants game, come here for pizza!
author: Helen T.

description: Super tasty high quality food in a nice atmosphere at a fair price. And the music is not annoying. I love Slice House.
author: Allison V.

description: Good pizza but slow and without service. It inexplicably takes 20 minutes to get slice of pizza even though it is already made and waiting. Drink refills have to be requested by walking up to the cashier with your glass. Don't bother sitting upstairs as you will be forgotten entirely by the staff.
author: Kyle K.

description: Way better than your average pizza-by-the-slice place.  Great beer selection as well!
author: William B.

description: The pizza here is great and so is the atmosphere. I'm from Chicago so I have a high bar for pizza, and this place meets it. Multiple big TV for watching sports, and great craft beers and drinks. There are great deals for happy hour and during Giants games, and trivia on Sundays at 5. Overall a great sports bar/pizza place in the city.
author: Katharine M.

description: Great spot for a casual meal. We kept it simple on the pizza side and just had a tomato pie with mozzarella and basil. The sauce was just sweet enough and the grains in the dough made for an interesting and delicious crust. The surprise standout was the bucatini. I would definitely recommend trying the pasta dishes. Very fresh and surprisingly reasonably priced.
author: Samantha S.

description: Best pizza I've seen so far in SF.  If you want the fancy pizzas order early.  Also remember you've got to eat pizza hot!  The fact that they have Sicilian pizza is also rockstar!
author: Michael S.

description: For the longest time Escape From New York pizza has been my favorite in SF but Slice House is a strong rival. Their crust is so tastey - chewy and crunchy with garlic and cornmeal on the bottom. We ordered a full pizza, half pepperoni and half mushroom, basil, sundries tomato. Both were delicious!
author: Rachel W.

description: I love to grab a slice at the Slice House. They have a good variety of pizza to choose from. They also make it super convenient to be able to just get a slice of pizza in lou of a whole pizza. The slices are around 5 bucks so not too bad. The service is quick for a pizza place, and nice employee's as well.
author: Ronald B.

description:
Came here after I received a coupon for it at Chronicle Books. 

Happily happened upon their happy hour, and got a slice of the Grandma w/ a pint of IPA. 

Legitimately one of the best slices of pizza I've ever tasted. Fresh, delicious ingredients; really cool specials; very cool aesthetic. 

Overall great experience. Definitely coming back.
author: Marissa H.

description: Good-sized, flavorful slices that pass the "droop test" (by not drooping when you fold and pick them up). However, it's not my favorite pizza in SF nor is it the least expensive.
author: Paul L.

description: Fast, delicious and no more driving to North Beach! Win-win!
author: Jennifer M.

description: I have never written a review before leaving a restaurant, but this has been a truly exceptional experience!  Really cool atmosphere. Greeted by the lovely Maddie, given tastes and histories of their delicious wine selection, super friendly and helpful in pizza description. :) AND THE PIZZA IS AMAZING!! And then there was Hunter. He was incredibly generous and sweet. Needless to say we will be back. With everyone for happy hour and dinner!! Thank you staff for some awesome eats.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
We have been going to Tony's in North Beach for a few years now and always love it so decided to try his Slice House offering while staying in the area. 

This is still Tony's! Still excellent pizza. We stopped in for a slice at lunchtime and was great to get a slice of Tony's pizza and be able to sit and eat it inside (was raining at the time so this was a double bonus).
author: Dave A.

description: Very good pizza. I've only come for lunch since I work nearby. My go to is always a slice of their pepperoni (sometimes 2). It's so cheesy and delectable and everything you could want in a pizza. They usually have a 'daily special' pizza that's worth a try. Last Friday it was purple potato, feta, bacon, and pesto cheese. It was insane, so good. Prices are good, its about $5.50 per slice. I usually get two slices and then waddle back to the office. Also their meatballs are also good and great to share if you're in a small group (3 for $5).
author: Elizabeth W.

description: The best pizza in San Francisco.  Seriously.  I recommend the tomato basil.  Not only is it a hefty size, the ingredients are so fresh and the crust is the perfect balance of crispiness and starchy fluffy middle.  Just avoid going here when there's a Giants home game.
author: Tammy N.

description: Delicious  large slices, fresh gourmet ingredients, my office mates are loving it too!
author: Karen S.

description: Tried this place out with a Groupon, and glad we did! The food was phenomenal. The portions are gigantic. The meatballs on the meatball sub are the size of baseballs. The wait time is a bit long, but we think it's worth it. We also really enjoyed the decor: rebuilt wooden tables and wooden walls - a nice look. We loved the upstairs - got to see the kitchen make the pizzas below. Definitely coming back here to try different things on the menu!
author: Convict T.

description:
The pizza and salads were first rate. I  would recommend the Slice House highly just based on the yummy factor. We tried 5 different pizzas and a couple of the salads and ALL were excellent. From plain cheese to the Popeye to the Wiseguy each pizza was a stand out depending on what you like.  
We had a great experience having a birthday party here. What REALLY stood out was the awesome lead staff. Maddy was so inviting and encouraging when we inquired about making a reservation. The follow-up and professionalism which Danielle provided made moving forward with our party planning a breeze. I  just wish this was my corner pizzeria!
author: Ernesto C.

description: Among the best gluten free pizzas you will find in the city. Go for the Wise Guy. Staff is very cool and friendly in ten out of ten visits. Happy to have them in the neighborhood.
author: J D.

description:
Save your money unless you have a few beers first to wash down the greasy pepperoni pizza

Best to go to Tony's places in North Beach
author: Matthew L.

description: Second straight day that I was given cold pizza. So frustrating. Won't be coming back. (never got cold pizza from the walnut creek location, hence the 5 star review I gave them)
author: Brooke F.

description: Dee-rish-us ( Pizza). Way to go guys. :) Friendly staff, great environment for a game. I work in the area and will definitely come back.
author: Ian M.

description: My favorite is a slice of tomato pie.  Their sauce is tangy and sweet at the same time and they pile on the mozzarella.  I also like the Grandma Sicilian style pizza.  Their crust is chewy and so satisfying.  Love that they sell by the slice and it's an easy place to pick up dinner on the way home from work.  Husband likes the meatball sandwich.  The mixed greens salad is also very satisfying with lots of olives, cheese, and glazed walnuts.
author: Nina L.

description: I have eaten many times at the Slice House.  Last night was a major disappointment.   Pizza quality was poor (less cheese and pepperoni).  Was not the same pizza I had a week ago.  Quality down and they raised the price of a slice.   Sad, not sure why meatballs still good.
author: Fred H.

description: Great pizza and salads. A great place to stop on your way to a game or if you are visiting AT&T Park. The staff were helpful and friendly. My kids loved the pizza. The slices are huge.
author: Marc H.

description: Friendly and welcoming service. We ordered 3 different slices, meatballs, Caesar salad and wings. We brought a 2 yr old toddler who doesn't eat pizza but tried theirs this time loved it!! They were so nice in offering to cut the gigantic slice into tiny pieces for her. Free refills on sodas too. It's the little things that make an experience enjoyable. The food is delicious and the atmosphere is great.
author: kelly y.

description:
Now been here twice, both times for dinner.  I think whole pies are the way to go, either the individual 12" (which you can easily share if you have a salad) or the enormous regular pizzas.  The slices, I think, don't fare well when reheated.  Portions of everything are huge -- from the salads to the pizzas

Hits:
Quinoa Salad is terrific and (tastes) worthy of a fine dining restaurant -- an unusual choice for a pizza place near the ball park.  Quinoa, citrus slices, goat cheese, currents, frisee, onions artfully displayed in a light citrus vinaigrette.  
Caesar is tasty but not as exceptional.  
Both standard veggie pizzas are good, but the Pesto is better.
Garlic bread covered with whole cloves of roasted garlic.  Huge portion.  

Miss:
Ancient Grains salad made with quinoa pasta is lacking in flavor versus the other choices.

The pasta and other items looks good -- will have to try them another time.  .
author: Greg K.

description: After being underwhelmed at pizza rock in Vegas I decided to give tony g another try when I stopped in San Fran this past week. What can I say other then another poor experience. Slice was cold and not spun out properly. Dough was bland and under proofed. Rookie mistakes for such a seasoned operator. Never trying another slice
author: Steven A.

description: The pizza is amazing, but they just started serving brunch and it is our new favorite spot.  You can get everything from eggs and bacon to an amazing slice of lasagna.  The meatballs and marinara are so delicious...it's like brunch with your favorite Italian family.  Throw in bottomless mimosas and sangria...heaven!
author: Mike M.

description: Order 3 slices and a salad togo. Got 2 out of 3 and was told sorry - cashier must of rang it in wrong. I know what I ordered
author: David H.

description: What a great addition to the neighborhood! Got an opportunity to have some delicious pizza today---thank you Julia! They also have fast and tasty breakfast items. Everyone was very friendly. I have been in a few times, had breakfast, pizza, and meatballs. Can't wait for my next visit to try more! A special note to anyone complaining about a long wait for food---- if there is line, and lots of people are placing orders at the same time as you--- what the heck do you expect!? Ithink it hilarious how a lot of the people who eat out around here expect a high quality, delicious product, at fast food speed. Long wait or not, Tony's is worth it!!
author: Danielle M.

description: Came here for Sunday Brunch. Was nicely surprised. Had the buffet which was excellent. Also pizza is some of the best I've had in the city.
author: Randall K.

description: Great service and great food! The Genoa was amazing and they have a great selection of beers on tap. I'll definitely be making this a new go-to for Friday work lunches and baseball pre-games.
author: Jessica H.

description: Great addition to the neighborhood! I went here on a Friday game night and got a slice of tomato basil, plain, Sicilian and grandma and a side of meatballs to go. The order was served up quickly.  The plain and Sicilian were my favorite, especially when dipped in the marinara sauce that accompanied the meatballs. The crust at this place is truly delicious. I'm so excited to have a regular pizza spot now and I will be back often.
author: Amy S.

description:
Great Pizza, but as a local resident I'm frustrated that it's impossible to tell when exactly they are open.
The hours on Yelp are incorrect. It shows up as open on Yelp, we walk there  at noon on Sat, and they say they don't open until 3p on Sat.
The hours also change on Game days.
There's no information on the storefront either.
I want to go there and eat on non-game days w/o standing in a long line, and that's not possible right now.
author: Ash M.

description: Awesome Pizza!!! The pasta was also amazing. Always eat too much because the food is so good. Our Saturday night   quick go to place instead of the long lines in North Beach.
author: Sharon S.

description: Awesome by the slice pizza, make sure you get there before the lunch/dinner rush or you'll be waiting in line for a while.
author: Hannah Grace P.

description: One of my favorite places ever since I moved around the area. My go to pizza was the delicious grandma's pan pizza. I sometimes would order through postmates and realize a few times I got it, it looked and tasted different. I thought possible they got my order wrong, but I just found out recently they changed the recipe. It is still good, but not as amazing as it was before. I am really sad :(, since that was one of the reasons I would come here was for that delicious slice of grandma's pizza. Please change the recipe back!
author: Victoria K.

description: Super crispy tasty crust & sauce. Loved the Sicillan pizza. The Caesar salad with anchovies were so fresh and delicious. The huge meatballs and chicken wings were also great. Lots of parking and seating during non-game days.
author: L L.

description:
I'm a big fan of their North Beach location, and this new spot doesn't disappoint. I got a tomato, cheese, and basil slice for $5.50. It was just about perfect. The crust, which is easily the best part, was crispy and dark on the bottom, but nice and fluffy once you bite into it. The cheese was just the right portion, and the sauce was nice and savory. They sprinkled fresh basil on top before serving so that it didn't dry out in the oven. It was easily one of the best slices of pizza I've had in SF.

$5.50 does at first seem a bit steep for one slice, but given the neighborhood, the quality of ingredients, and the portion size, it's well worth it. My only real complaint was the long line and wait time, which ended up being about 30 minutes for a to-go slice. Given that it was their first or second day open, I'll give them a pass for now.
author: Evan O.

description: Went there before a Billy Joel concert at AT&T. They do not handle large crowds well. Line out the door, no seating. Cafeteria stile. Had to stand by someone table that was almost finished to get a seat. They ran out of forks, asked the buss boy three times for a fork to eat our salad. Pizza when you order a specialty pizza is great takes 20 to 30 mins so don't order this if in a hurry. Pizza by the slice is ordinary. Only cheese and pepperoni available and Luke warm.  Would give it more than two stars if the service was better.  My wife has a gluten allergy. They had gluten free available for extra cost. $25 for a 12" pizza.  Wow welcome to SF.
author: Kerri B.

description: Love the pizza, but the operation is pretty sad. In the last two months, I have gone in multiple times and three times, they have been "closing" anywhere between 1.5hrs to 45 min earlier than their posted time. Happened today with more than 45 minutes to spare, and we were told it was slow because of Mother's Day so they ushered us out. Frustrating, it's the best pizza in SOMA, but so unreliable. Heading to our number two choice, and will probably not go back since we never know if they will be open and operating.
author: RochelleRochelle M.

description: This place is awful! The server was extremely rude to multiple customers. The pizza slice selection is non extant. My friend ordered a basic slice of cheese pizza and they presented her with an almost inedible hunk of cardboard. We asked for some ranch dipping sauce to moisten said slice and he denied us this opportunity due to the refrigerator being closed. Don't waste your time, you've been warned.
author: Jasmine T.

description: Don't believe the hours posted here and on their web site. Tried to stop here on our way home for a quick bite. We arrived Monday night at 9:20pm. The doors were closed, and they were not interested in serving us. Their posted hours say they're open till 10pm.
author: Armen A.

description: Pizza is decent, but don't bother if there is an event at AT&T Park. Very busy and you will not be able to order beer, or eat in. Good for take out sloces only. That said, the food is OK.
author: Kevin S.

description: This pizza is on a whole 'nother level than anything else in the neighborhood.  A simple slice of cheese is a perfect study on the art of making a perfect pizza:  glorious cheese with fine seasoning atop, rich flavorful tomato sauce underneath, held together with a perfect pizza crust, foldable and flaky (eat your crust Jimmy).  Their meatball sandwich is also off the charts....3 delicious meatballs covered in sauce tucked inside ridiculously tasty and flaky bread.  And the Sicilian slice is as if it was sent from heaven.  I can't say enough great things about this place and how it has stepped up the game in the neighborhood.  Well done Tony...I hope you thrive in this location for years and years.
author: Mike Z.

description: Being a regular at Tonys in north beach which we absolutely love, we figured we would try the slice house as it's closer to where we live.....BIG MISTAKE!!!.....called up and asked for a cal Italian and a margherita $59 for 2 pizzas..of which the margherita was 20 inches which I didn't realize until I got there...REALLY!!.....paid for the pizzas when we got there and had a beer while we waited, time went by, the server said nothing and no one came over to us, so I looked around after 20 mins or so and there were 2 boxes with pizzas in them under a heat lamp that was turned off so we end up picking them up and taking it to our table to have one slice while finishing our beer. The margherita (tomato pie) was barely warm, stodgy and finished with a lot of that cheap looking cheese that you buy from the grocery store on top. when we got home I opened the cal Italia and it had huge lumps of fig preserve on it and burnt (black) on the bottom, way too much and very very sweet, felt like I was eating dessert. Totally not worth it, not to mention we tried to go a week earlier at 5 pm and they said they were closed when they advertise they are open until 7 pm.
author: Graham W.

description: The pizza was five stars. Those little pepperonis and the tomato and cheese pizza were both fantastic! However, even for soma this place is crazy expensive. A slice of cheese for five dollars, oh man. It's good but not quite that good!
author: Ethan H.

description: Probably the worst customer service I've experienced in a very long time. My boyfriend and I came in on a Monday evening, around 7m. We thought we'd grab a quick bite to eat before the Giants game. We ordered and sat upstairs, where there were probably about 3 tables occupied. We waited and drank our beers that we ordered to go along with our pizzas. We noticed everyone around us getting their food except us. We figured they had to make a new batch of pizza for our order, so we didn't think much of it. Then about an hour passed and still no pizza! My boyfriend finally asked the front what was taking so long, and they said they were busy and lost our ticket! They offered to refund us for our pizza, which obviously was expected. Then I came downstairs and asked them what happened. They simply ignored me and gave us our receipt, showing us of our refund. I asked again, what happened?? Again, ignored me. I asked numerous times and they said they were JUST busy...BUT at least I got to down my beer! Really? So we missed part of the Giants game to wait an hour for some pizza we were never even served? I'm never coming to this place again and I will definitely encourage others to do the same if they don't want to waste their time.
author: Jane G.

description: Wack. Wack wack! This may be pizza to San Fran. But I live in New York and this sure as hell ain't pizza. It's so horrible it tastes more like a sweet pie then pizza yuck. Absolutely would never get again. And for $5!!! I would go to the absolute best pizza in New York where the guy stepped off the plane from Naples and pay less then that! Yuck!
author: Leya r.

description: This is awesome that we do not have to go to Washington Square to get Tony's pizza.  The only drawback, according to the dinner menu, is that you cannot get all the specialty pizza's that I  love at Tony's Neopolitina. The reason why I did not give this location Five Stars as I do the original location, is attributed to that on Giants game day their menu becomes very limited.  So  this little fact was not known to me or well publicized.  Not knowing this fact, I walked to Slices for two  whole pizzas as take out. I was only able to choose whole pies from what slices they were serving (pepperoni, cheese, grandma, and Sicilian). So if you want more of a selection  check to see if the Giants are in town.  Even though it was limited the guys made a fresh whole Grandma and Pepperoni pizzas for my take out.  For two whole pizzas expect to shell out over $75.00
author: Robert J.

description: Pizza is great, but the hours of operation are baffling.  There is no way to tell when this place is actually open without calling.  Yelp! posted hours of operation are way off.  Saturday they don't open until 3.  Sunday sometimes they close at 3.  They are also "subject to game day changes".
author: Michael S.

description: just moved into town and looking for a good goto pizza place.  found it here,  great atmosphere and pizza is great!
author: Wilson K.

description: newly opened wtih much hoopla and always a crowd.  went today early for lunch..  slices are double size of standard slices and therefore not overly expensive, but cheese used is very salty and not to my taste.  what was worse was that the slices were served warm but not hot. also had an order of meatballs and plate was hot but mealballs were cold, and had to be sent back to go into the microwave for re-heating..  certainly not world famous in my estimation...
author: ira l.
